attribute.description: Data type of the value object (optional). Any primitive type, array, non generic or generic type is supported. Data type is sometimes required to convert a value to a JSON representation. All data types should be fully qualified. Default is null.

tag.description: Calculator adds a popup calculator to a given input field. Client behavior events: open - fires when the calculator is opened (org.primefaces.extensions.event.OpenEvent), close - fires when the calculator is closed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.CloseEvent), button - fires when each calculator button is pressed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.ButtonEvent).

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: When to display the calculator: 'focus' for popup on focus, 'button' for trigger button, 'both' for either, 'operator' for non-numeric character entered, 'opbutton' for operator/button combination.
attribute.name: showOn

attribute.description: The layout of keys: 'standard', scientific', or a custom defined layout.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: String or java.util.Locale representing user locale. Default is a locale specified in view root.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: The number of digits of precision to use in rounding for display. Default is 10.
attribute.name: precision

attribute.description: Defines text direction, valid values are "ltr" (default) and "rtl".
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: Style class of the main container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The target input.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute before a popup calculator opens and allows the field value to be altered before use.
attribute.name: onopen

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when the calculator closes and provides the (possibly updated) field value, and the calculator instance object.
attribute.name: onclose

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute for each activated button and provides the button's label, the current calculator value, and the calculator instance object.
attribute.name: onbutton

tag.description:
A JSF component that wraps the JavaScript libary Monaco Editor. This component renders the editor directly into the host page without an iframe. Available client behavior events:
  • blur - fired when the editor loses focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidBlurEditorWidget.
  • change - fired if the content has been changed (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidChangeModelContent.
  • focus - fired when the editor gets focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidFocusEditorWidget.
    • ,
  • initialized - fired when the editor has become ready (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). That is, after required resources have been downloaded and the editor was fully created and can now be interacted with by the user.
  • keydown - fired when a key was pressed down on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyDown.
    • ,
  • keyup - fired when a key was released on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyUp.
    • ,
  • mousedown - fired when a mouse button was pressed down on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseDown.
    • ,
  • mousemove - fired when the mouse was moved over the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseMove.
    • ,
  • mouseup - fired when a mouse button was released down on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseUp.
    • ,
  • paste - fired when the text was pasted into the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent),
    • ,

attribute.description: Allows you to register custom themes with the editor via Java. This must be a Map<String, org.primefaces.extensions.model.monacoeditor.EditorStandaloneTheme>. It maps between the name of the theme and the styling data for that theme. You can then specify the theme name for the theme option in the editorOptions.
attribute.name: customThemes

attribute.description: Locale for the user interface. Can be either a java.util.Locale object or a string with the locale code. Built-in languages are "cs", "de", "en", "es", "fr", "it", "ja", "ko", "pl", "pt_BR", "ru", "tr", "zh_CN", and "zh_TW". To use a custom language or translation, you can specify a language file with custom translations via the option localeUrl.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: For custom language files. If given, this is used instead of the built-in language files. This URL must point to a JavaScript file that, when executed, adds the localization to window.MonacoEnvironment.Locale["LOCALE_CODE"], where LOCALE_CODE is the value you set for locale. See the language file the widget downloads (when locale is not set to English) for an example and all available messages that need to be translated.
attribute.name: localeUrl

attribute.description:
An extender object to further customize the monaco editor via JavaScript. This can be either:

  • unset, in which case no further customization is performed
  • or a JavaScript expression that evaluates to an extender object
The extender object may have one or more of the following optional properties:
  • beforeCreate(editorWidget, options). Called before the monaco editor is created. It is passed the current options object that would be used to initialize the monaco editor. If this callback does not return a value, the options are used as they were passed to the callback. The callback is allowed to modify the passed options object. If the callback returns an options object, that options object is used instead. If it returns a thenable/Promise, the monaco editor is created only once the Promise resolves (successfully). If the Promise resolves with an options object, that options object is used to create the editor. See IStandaloneEditorConstructionOptions for all editor options.
  • afterCreate(editorWidget). Called after the editor was created.
  • beforeDestroy(editorWidget). Called before the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX.
  • afterDestroy(editorWidget). Called after the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX. Note that editorWidget.getMonaco() now returns undefined.
  • createModel(editorWidget, options). Called when a model needs to retrieved or created. The options contains value (current value that should be set on the model by the extender), url (default URL that was determined for the model), language (requested code language), and editorOptions (monaco editor constructor options). Should return the model. When it returns nothing, the default mechanism for creating a model is used. Note that editorWidget.getMonaco() returns undefined as the monaco editor was not created yet.
  • createEditorOverrideServices(editorWidget, options). Called when the monaco editor is created. May return an object with services that should be overriden. See here on github for details on the available services. The options are the editor constructor options that will be used to create the editor, they are readonly and must not be changed.
  • createWorker(editorWidget, moduleId, label). Called when a worker for additional language support needs to be created. By default, monaco editor ships with the workers for JSON, CSS, HTML, and TYPESCRIPT. The label is the name of the language, eg. css or javascript. Must return the worker to be used for the given language. Note that editorWidget.getMonaco() returns undefined as the monaco editor was not created yet.
attribute.name: extender

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the scheme (protocol) for that URI. Defaults to inmemory.
attribute.name: scheme

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the directory (path) for that URI, with parts separated by slashes. If not given, it is taken from the client ID of this component.
attribute.name: directory

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the basename for that URI, without the extension. If not given, default to 'file'.
attribute.name: basename

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the extension for that URI, with or without the period. If not given, it is inferred from the (code) language.
attribute.name: extension

attribute.description: Width of the editor with CSS units, set as an inline style. For example 500px or 100%/code>. Set this to the empty string in case you want to size the editor via CSS.
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: Height of the editor with CSS units, set as an inline style. For example 500px or 100%/code>. Set this to the empty string in case you want to size the editor via CSS.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Options for the Monaco code editor. This is a simple wrapper around the JavaScript API, see IEditorConstructionOptions The code language can be set via the EditorOptions#setLanguage option.
attribute.name: editorOptions

attribute.description: If true, resizes the editor automatically when the iframe element changes its size. Please note that this makes uses of the new ResizeObserver API and works only in newer browers. This widget checks whether ResizeObserver API is available, and when it is not, no resizing is performed. To support resizing for older browsers, search for a ResizeObserver polyfill. If you know when the size of the editor conainer could have changed, you can resize the editor manually via PF("editorWidgetVar").layout()
attribute.name: autoResize

attribute.description: A PrimeFaces search expression of a component. Places overflow widgets inside an external DOM node. Defaults to an internal DOM node when not given. May be useful when the editor is used inside an element obscured by other components. You can, for example, append the overflow widget to the body. Note 1: you probably also need to set fixedOverflowWidgets on the editor options for this to work. Note 2: For now, you either need to add the CSS class monaco-editor to the container to style the overflow widgets properly, or add the appropriate CSS yourself. Note 3: As of monaco-editor 0.27.0, this option has several issues with event handling, use at your own risk. This will most likely be fixed in a later version of monaco-editor.
attribute.name: overflowWidgetsDomNode

tag.description:
A JSF component that wraps the JavaScript libary Monaco Editor. This component renders the editor inside an iframe for improved encapsulation, as the monaco editor library and its settings are window global. This also mean that you cannot get access to the monaco editor instance from the PrimeFaces widget. However, the widget offers a method invokeMonaco(methodName, ...params) that lets you call a method on the monaco editor instance in the iframe -- the method parameters are sent via postMessage. Note, however, that this does not work for methods that takes a non-data object as a parameter or return such an object (i.e. an object that cannot be structurally cloned). Available client behavior events:
  • blur - fired when the editor loses focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidBlurEditorWidget.
  • change - fired if the content has been changed (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidChangeModelContent.
  • focus - fired when the editor gets focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidFocusEditorWidget.
    • ,
  • initialized - fired when the editor has become ready (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). That is, after required resources have been downloaded and the editor was fully created and can now be interacted with by the user.
  • keydown - fired when a key was pressed down on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyDown.
    • ,
  • keyup - fired when a key was released on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyUp.
    • ,
  • mousedown - fired when a mouse button was pressed down on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseDown.
    • ,
  • mousemove - fired when the mouse was moved over the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseMove.
    • ,
  • mouseup - fired when a mouse button was released down on the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseUp.
    • ,
  • paste - fired when the text was pasted into the editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent),
    • ,

attribute.description:
An extender object to further customize the monaco editor via JavaScript. This must be a URL to a JavaScript file with the extender. The JavaScript file is loaded inside the iframe context and must (synchronously, i.e. upon its execution) set window.MonacoEnvironment.Extender to the extender object that is to be used.

The extender object may have one or more of the following optional properties:
  • beforeCreate(monacoContext, options). Called before the monaco editor is created. It is passed the current options object that would be used to initialize the monaco editor. If this callback does not return a value, the options are used as they were passed to the callback. The callback is allowed to modify the passed options object. If the callback returns an options object, that options object is used instead. If it returns a thenable/Promise, the monaco editor is created only once the Promise resolves (successfully). If the Promise resolves with an options object, that options object is used to create the editor. See IStandaloneEditorConstructionOptions for all editor options.
  • afterCreate(monacoContext). Called after the editor was created.
  • beforeDestroy(monacoContext). Called before the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX.
  • afterDestroy(monacoContext). Called after the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX. Note that monacoContext.getMonaco() now returns undefined.
  • createEditorOverrideServices(monacoContext, options). Called when the monaco editor is created. May return an object with services that should be overriden. See here on github for details on the available services. The options are the editor constructor options that will be used to create the editor, they are readonly and must not be changed.
  • createModel(monacoContext, options). Called when a model needs to retrieved or created. The options contains value (current value that should be set on the model by the extender), url (default URL that was determined for the model), language (requested code language), and editorOptions (monaco editor constructor options). Should return the model. When it returns nothing, the default mechanism for creating a model is used. Note that monacoContext.getMonaco() returns undefined as the Monaco editor was not created yet.
  • createWorker(monacoContext, moduleId, label). Called when a worker for additional language support needs to be created. By default, monaco editor ships with the workers for JSON, CSS, HTML, and TYPESCRIPT. The label is the name of the language, eg. css or javascript. Must return the worker to be used for the given language. Note that monacoContext.getMonaco() returns undefined as the Monaco editor was not created yet.
All methods of the extender are evaluated within the iframe page, so the editor widget instance is not available. The monacoContext passed as the first argument to the extender methods is an object with one essential method: getMonaco(). Use this method to get the current monaco editor instance and interact with the editor.
attribute.name: extender

attribute.description: Additional URL parameters that are added to the iframe URL where the framed Monaco editor is loaded. This may be useful, for example, when you wish to pass additional arguments to the extender script. Must be either a java.lang.Map<String, String | List<String>> (i.e. a map where keys are strings and values are strings or lists of strings); or a java.lang.String with a JavaScript expression that evaluates to an object representing such a map.
attribute.name: iframeUrlParams

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the scheme (protocol) for that URI. Defaults to inmemory.
attribute.name: scheme

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the directory (path) for that URI, with parts separated by slashes. If not given, it is taken from the client ID of this component.
attribute.name: directory

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the basename for that URI, without the extension. If not given, default to 'file'.
attribute.name: basename

attribute.description: The monaco editor requires a unique URI for an opened model (i.e. the code currently being edited). This is the extension for that URI, with or without the period. If not given, it is inferred from the (code) language.
attribute.name: extension

attribute.description: Width of the editor with CSS units, set as an inline style. For example 500px or 100%/code>. Set this to the empty string in case you want to size the editor via CSS.
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: Height of the editor with CSS units, set as an inline style. For example 500px or 100%/code>. Set this to the empty string in case you want to size the editor via CSS.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Options for the monaco code editor. This is a simple wrapper around the JavaScript API, see IEditorConstructionOptions The code language can be set via the EditorOptions#setLanguage option.

This widget checks whether ResizeObserver API is available, and when it is not, no resizing is performed. To support resizing for older browsers, search for a ResizeObserver polyfill. If you know when the size of the editor conainer could have changed, you can resize the editor manually via PF("editorWidgetVar").layout()
attribute.name: autoResize

attribute.description: The code language for the modified editor, such as typescript or css. This is also the language for the original editor when originalLanguage is not specified. Defaults to plaintext when not specified. Can be either a string or one of the constants defined in org.primefaces.extensions.model.monacoeditor.ELanguage.
attribute.name: language

attribute.description: The code language for the original editor, such as typescript or css. Defaults to language when not specified. Can be either a string or one of the constants defined in org.primefaces.extensions.model.monacoeditor.ELanguage.
attribute.name: originalLanguage

attribute.description: Allows you to register custom themes with the editor via Java. This must be a Map<String, org.primefaces.extensions.model.monacoeditor.EditorStandaloneTheme>. It maps between the name of the theme and the styling data for that theme. You can then specify the theme name for the theme option in the editorOptions.
attribute.name: customThemes

attribute.description: Locale for the user interface. Can be either a java.util.Locale object or a string with the locale code. Built-in languages are "cs", "de", "en", "es", "fr", "it", "ja", "ko", "pl", "pt_BR", "ru", "tr", "zh_CN", and "zh_TW". To use a custom language or translation, you can specify a language file with custom translations via the option localeUrl.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: For custom language files. If given, this is used instead of the built-in language files. This URL must point to a JavaScript file that, when executed, adds the localization to window.MonacoEnvironment.Locale["LOCALE_CODE"], where LOCALE_CODE is the value you set for locale. See the language file the widget downloads (when locale is not set to English) for an example and all available messages that need to be translated.
attribute.name: localeUrl

attribute.description:
An extender object to further customize the monaco editor via JavaScript. This can be either:

  • unset, in which case no further customization is performed
  • or a JavaScript expression that evaluates to an extender object
The extender object may have one or more of the following optional properties:
  • beforeCreate(editorWidget, options). Called before the monaco editor is created. It is passed the current options object that would be used to initialize the monaco editor. If this callback does not return a value, the options are used as they were passed to the callback. The callback is allowed to modify the passed options object. If the callback returns an options object, that options object is used instead. If it returns a thenable/Promise, the monaco editor is created only once the Promise resolves (successfully). If the Promise resolves with an options object, that options object is used to create the editor. See IStandaloneDiffEditorConstructionOptions for all editor options.
  • afterCreate(editorWidget). Called after the editor was created.
  • beforeDestroy(editorWidget). Called before the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX.
  • afterDestroy(editorWidget). Called after the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX. Note that editorWidget.getMonaco() now returns undefined.
  • createModel(editorWidget, options). Called when a for the modified editor model needs to retrieved or created. The options contains value (current value that should be set on the model by the extender), url (default URL that was determined for the model), language (requested code language), and editorOptions (monaco editor constructor options). Should return the model. When it returns nothing, the default mechanism for creating a model is used. Note that editorWidget.getMonaco() returns undefined as the monaco editor was not created yet.
  • createOriginalModel(editorWidget, options). Called when a model for the original editor needs to retrieved or created. The options contains value (current value that should be set on the model by the extender), url (default URL that was determined for the model), language (requested code language), and editorOptions (monaco editor constructor options). Should return the model. When it returns nothing, the default mechanism for creating a model is used. Note that editorWidget.getMonaco() returns undefined as the monaco editor was not created yet.
  • createEditorOverrideServices(editorWidget, options). Called when the monaco editor is created. May return an object with services that should be overriden. See here on github for details on the available services. The options are the editor constructor options that will be used to create the editor, they are readonly and must not be changed.
  • createWorker(editorWidget, moduleId, label). Called when a worker for additional language support needs to be created. By default, monaco editor ships with the workers for JSON, CSS, HTML, and TYPESCRIPT. The label is the name of the language, eg. css or javascript. Must return the worker to be used for the given language. Note that editorWidget.getMonaco() returns undefined as the monaco editor was not created yet.
attribute.name: extender

attribute.name: scheme

attribute.name: extension

attribute.description: Width of the editor with CSS units, set as an inline style. For example 500px or 100%/code>. Set this to the empty string in case you want to size the editor via CSS.
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: Height of the editor with CSS units, set as an inline style. For example 500px or 100%/code>. Set this to the empty string in case you want to size the editor via CSS.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Options for the Monaco code editor. This is a simple wrapper around the JavaScript API, see IEditorConstructionOptions The code language can be set via the EditorOptions#setLanguage option.
attribute.name: editorOptions

attribute.description: If true, resizes the editor automatically when the iframe element changes its size. Please note that this makes uses of the new ResizeObserver API and works only in newer browers. This widget checks whether ResizeObserver API is available, and when it is not, no resizing is performed. To support resizing for older browsers, search for a ResizeObserver polyfill. If you know when the size of the editor conainer could have changed, you can resize the editor manually via PF("editorWidgetVar").layout()
attribute.name: autoResize

attribute.description: A PrimeFaces search expression of a component. Places overflow widgets inside an external DOM node. Defaults to an internal DOM node when not given. May be useful when the editor is used inside an element obscured by other components. You can, for example, append the overflow widget to the body. Note 1: you probably also need to set fixedOverflowWidgets on the editor options for this to work. Note 2: For now, you either need to add the CSS class monaco-editor to the container to style the overflow widgets properly, or add the appropriate CSS yourself. Note 3: As of monaco-editor 0.27.0, this option has several issues with event handling, use at your own risk. This will most likely be fixed in a later version of monaco-editor.
attribute.name: overflowWidgetsDomNode

tag.description:
A JSF component that wraps the JavaScript libary Monaco Editor. This component renders the diff editor inside an iframe for improved encapsulation, as the Monaco editor library and its settings are window global. This also mean that you cannot get access to the monaco editor instance from the PrimeFaces widget. However, the widget offers a method invokeMonaco(methodName, ...params) that lets you call a method on the monaco editor instance in the iframe -- the method parameters are sent via postMessage. Note, however, that this does not work for methods that takes a non-data object as a parameter or return such an object (i.e. an object that cannot be structurally cloned). Available client behavior events:
  • initialized - fired when the editor has become ready (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). That is, after required resources have been downloaded and the editor was fully created and can now be interacted with by the user.
  • originalBlur - fired when the original editor loses focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidBlurEditorWidget.
  • originalChange - fired if the content of the original editor has been changed (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidChangeModelContent.
  • originalFocus - fired when the original editor gets focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidFocusEditorWidget.
    • ,
  • originalKeydown - fired when a key was pressed down on the original editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyDown.
    • ,
  • originalKeyup - fired when a key was released on the original editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyUp.
    • ,
  • originalMousedown - fired when a mouse button was pressed down on the original editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseDown.
    • ,
  • originalMousemove - fired when the mouse was moved over the original editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseMove.
    • ,
  • originalMouseup - fired when a mouse button was released down on the original editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseUp.
    • ,
  • originalPaste - fired when the text was pasted into the original editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent),
    • ,
  • blur - fired when the modified editor loses focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidBlurEditorWidget.
  • change - fired if the content of the modified editor has been changed (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidChangeModelContent.
  • focus - fired when the modified editor gets focus (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onDidFocusEditorWidget.
    • ,
  • keydown - fired when a key was pressed down on the modified editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyDown.
    • ,
  • keyup - fired when a key was released on the modified editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onKeyUp.
    • ,
  • mousedown - fired when a mouse button was pressed down on the modified editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseDown.
    • ,
  • mousemove - fired when the mouse was moved over the modified editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseMove.
    • ,
  • mouseup - fired when a mouse button was released down on the modified editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent). Corresponds to IStandaloneCodeEditor#onMouseUp.
    • ,
  • paste - fired when the text was pasted into the modified editor (javax.faces.event.AjaxBehaviorEvent),
    • ,

attribute.description:
An extender object to further customize the monaco editor via JavaScript. This must be a URL to a JavaScript file with the extender. The JavaScript file is loaded inside the iframe context and must (synchronously, i.e. upon its execution) set window.MonacoEnvironment.Extender to the extender object that is to be used.

The extender object may have one or more of the following optional properties:
  • beforeCreate(monacoContext, options). Called before the monaco editor is created. It is passed the current options object that would be used to initialize the monaco editor. If this callback does not return a value, the options are used as they were passed to the callback. The callback is allowed to modify the passed options object. If the callback returns an options object, that options object is used instead. If it returns a thenable/Promise, the monaco editor is created only once the Promise resolves (successfully). If the Promise resolves with an options object, that options object is used to create the editor. See IStandaloneDiffEditorConstructionOptions for all editor options.
  • afterCreate(monacoContext). Called after the editor was created.
  • beforeDestroy(monacoContext). Called before the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX.
  • afterDestroy(monacoContext). Called after the editor is destroyed, eg. when updating a component via AJAX. Note that monacoContext.getMonaco() now returns undefined.
  • createEditorOverrideServices(monacoContext, options). Called when the monaco editor is created. May return an object with services that should be overriden. See here on github for details on the available services. The options are the editor constructor options that will be used to create the editor, they are readonly and must not be changed.
  • createModel(monacoContext, options). Called when a model for the modified needs to retrieved or created. The options contains value (current value that should be set on the model by the extender), url (default URL that was determined for the model), language (requested code language), and editorOptions (monaco editor constructor options). Should return the model. When it returns nothing, the default mechanism for creating a model is used. Note that monacoContext.getMonaco() returns undefined as the Monaco editor was not created yet.
  • createOriginalModel(monacoContext, options). Called when a model for the original editor needs to retrieved or created. The options contains value (current value that should be set on the model by the extender), url (default URL that was determined for the model), language (requested code language), and editorOptions (monaco editor constructor options). Should return the model. When it returns nothing, the default mechanism for creating a model is used. Note that monacoContext.getMonaco() returns undefined as the Monaco editor was not created yet.
  • createWorker(monacoContext, moduleId, label). Called when a worker for additional language support needs to be created. By default, monaco editor ships with the workers for JSON, CSS, HTML, and TYPESCRIPT. The label is the name of the language, eg. css or javascript. Must return the worker to be used for the given language. Note that monacoContext.getMonaco() returns undefined as the Monaco editor was not created yet.
All methods of the extender are evaluated within the iframe page, so the editor widget instance is not available. The monacoContext passed as the first argument to the extender methods is an object with one essential method: getMonaco(). Use this method to get the current monaco editor instance and interact with the editor.
attribute.name: extender

attribute.description: Additional URL parameters that are added to the iframe URL where the framed Monaco editor is loaded. This may be useful, for example, when you wish to pass additional arguments to the extender script. Must be either a java.lang.Map<String, String | List<String>> (i.e. a map where keys are strings and values are strings or lists of strings); or a java.lang.String with a JavaScript expression that evaluates to an object representing such a map.
attribute.name: iframeUrlParams

attribute.description: When set to true, ajax requests are not queued. Default value: false.
attribute.name: async

attribute.description: When enabled, only values related to partially processed components would be serialized for ajax instead of whole form.
attribute.name: partialSubmit

attribute.description: When set to true, command will be invoked on page load.
attribute.name: autoRun

attribute.description: If true, components which autoUpdate="true" will not be updated for this request. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.
attribute.name: ignoreAutoUpdate

attribute.description: Selector to use when partial submit is on, default is ":input" to select all descendant inputs of a partially processed components.
attribute.name: partialSubmitFilter

attribute.description: If true, unresolvable components referenced in the update/process attribute are ignored. Default is 'false' and therefore a ComponentNotFoundException will be thrown.
attribute.name: ignoreComponentNotFound

tag.description: AssignableParam can be used the apply a parameter of the RemoteCommand to a backing bean.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the parameter.
attribute.name: name

attribute.description: ValueExpression where the parameter will be applied.
attribute.name: assignTo

attribute.description: An EL expression or a literal text that defines a converter for the component. When it's an EL expression, it's resolved to a converter instance. In case it's a static text, it must refer to a converter id.
attribute.name: converter

tag.description: Method can be used to receive a parameter of the RemoteCommand in the actionListener or action method.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the parameter.
attribute.name: name

attribute.description: An EL expression or a literal text that defines a converter for the component. When it's an EL expression, it's resolved to a converter instance. In case it's a static text, it must refer to a converter id.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: A comma separated list with full qualified class names. Class names should match passed parameters in the same order as they were defined.
attribute.name: parameters

tag.description: Advanced Tooltip component.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Value of the component than can be either an EL expression of a literal text.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: An EL expression or a literal text that defines a converter for the component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: A global tooltip converts each title attribute to a tooltip. Default value is false.
attribute.name: global

attribute.description: A shared tooltip - one tooltip, multiple targets. Default value is false.
attribute.name: shared

attribute.description: This flag enables showing tooltips automatically after page loading. Auto shown tooltips can not be global or shared. Default value is false.
attribute.name: autoShow

attribute.description: This flag enables tooltip's positioning in relation to the mouse. Default value is false.
attribute.name: mouseTracking

attribute.description: When set to true, the tooltip will not hide if moused over, allowing the contents to be clicked and interacted with. Default value is false.
attribute.name: fixed

attribute.description: Style class of the tooltip will override ThemeRoller theme. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Header or Titlebar of the tooltip. Not applicable on global tooltips. Default value is null.
attribute.name: header

attribute.description: A positive or negative pixel value by which to offset the tooltip in the horizontal plane (x-axis). Negative values cause a reduction in the value (moves tooltip to the left). Default value is 0.
attribute.name: adjustX

attribute.description: A positive or negative pixel value by which to offset the tooltip in the vertical plane (y-axis). Negative values cause a reduction in the value (moves tooltip upwards). Default value is 0.
attribute.name: adjustY

attribute.description: The corner of the target element to position the tooltips corner at. Default value is 'bottom right'.
attribute.name: atPosition

attribute.description: The corner of the tooltip to position in relation to the target element. Default value is 'top left'.
attribute.name: myPosition

attribute.description: Event displaying the tooltip. Default value is mouseenter.
attribute.name: showEvent

attribute.description: Delay time for displaying the tooltip. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: showDelay

attribute.description: Effect to be used for displaying. Default value is fadeIn.
attribute.name: showEffect

attribute.description: Time in milliseconds to display the effect. Default value is 500.
attribute.name: showEffectLength

attribute.description: Event hiding the tooltip. Default value is mouseleave.
attribute.name: hideEvent

attribute.description: Delay time for hiding the tooltip. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: hideDelay

attribute.description: Effect to be used for hiding. Default value is fadeOut.
attribute.name: hideEffect

attribute.description: Time in milliseconds to process the hide effect. Default value is 500.
attribute.name: hideEffectLength

attribute.description: Id of the component to attach the tooltip.
attribute.name: for

tag.description: Page Layout component. Client behavior events: open - fires after a layout pane gets opened (org.primefaces.extensions.event.OpenEvent), close - fires after a layout pane gets closed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.CloseEvent), resize - fires after a layout pane gets resized (org.primefaces.extensions.event.ResizeEvent).

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Specifies whether layout should span all page or not. Default value is true.
attribute.name: fullPage

attribute.description: Layout options as an instance of the class LayoutOptions or an JSON String representing serialized LayoutOptions. LayoutOptions created as Java model takes precedence over layout options as tag attributes. Serializing of layout options to an JSON string can increase the time of layout building when the layout is built during application startup in an application scoped bean (LayoutOptions gets always serialized to JSON to be able to be used in the underlying widget). Use the method toJson() in the LayoutOptions if you want to serialize all options to an JSON string.
attribute.name: options

attribute.description: Style of the main Layout container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Style class of the main Layout container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Indicates server-side state management. A hash (JSON string) containing all dimensions and close, open state of existing layout panes. It can be bound to a bean.
attribute.name: state

attribute.description: Indicates client-side state management. When set to true the current layout state will be stored in HTML5 LocalStorage on window unload and restored during layout build-up when user enters the same page. Default is false.
attribute.name: stateCookie

attribute.description: Tip when resizer-bar can be dragged to resize a pane. Default is 'Resize'.
attribute.name: resizerTip

attribute.description: Tip when the resizer-bar will trigger 'sliding open'. Default is 'Slide Open'.
attribute.name: sliderTip

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'open'. Default is 'Close'.
attribute.name: togglerTipOpen

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'closed'. Default is 'Open'.
attribute.name: togglerTipClosed

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with iframes or objects like applets inside layout panes. This option triggers masking each time the mouse moves over a resizer - instead of waiting until your 'grab it' with your mouse. This is done just in case you are about to grab & drag the resizer. Enabling this avoids the slight delay that sometimes occurs when you quickly grab a resizer and try to drag over an iframe or object. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskPanesEarly

tag.description: Layout pane within Layout component. 5 regions are supported: 'north', 'south', 'center', 'west' und 'east'.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Position of a pane. Possible values are 'north', 'south', 'west', 'east', 'center'. Default value is 'center'.
attribute.name: position

attribute.description: Style of the pane's header. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleHeader

attribute.description: Style class of the pane's header. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClassHeader

attribute.description: Style of the pane's content. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleContent

attribute.description: Style class of the pane's content. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClassContent

attribute.description: Makes a pane resizable. Default is true.
attribute.name: resizable

attribute.description: Makes a pane closable. Default is true.
attribute.name: closable

attribute.description: When closed, can a pane 'slide open' over adjacent panes. Default is true.
attribute.name: slidable

attribute.description: Specifies the initial size of a pane in px or %. Default value is null.
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-size limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null.
attribute.name: minSize

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-size limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null.
attribute.name: maxSize

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-width limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as small as pane can go.
attribute.name: minWidth

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-width limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as large as pane can go.
attribute.name: maxWidth

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-height limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as small as pane can go.
attribute.name: minHeight

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-height limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as large as pane can go.
attribute.name: maxHeight

attribute.description: Spacing in px between pane and adjacent pane - when pane is 'open'. Default value is 6.
attribute.name: spacingOpen

attribute.description: Spacing in px between pane and adjacent pane - when pane is 'closed'. Default value is 6.
attribute.name: spacingClosed

attribute.description: Tip when resizer-bar can be dragged to resize a pane. Default is 'Resize'.
attribute.name: resizerTip

attribute.description: Tip when the resizer-bar will trigger 'sliding open'. Default is 'Slide Open'.
attribute.name: sliderTip

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'open'. Default is 'Close'.
attribute.name: togglerTipOpen

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'closed'. Default is 'Open'.
attribute.name: togglerTipClosed

attribute.description: If true, then pane is 'closed' when layout is created. Default is false.
attribute.name: initClosed

attribute.description: If true, then pane is hidden when layout is created - no resizer or spacing is visible, as if the pane does not exist. Default is false.
attribute.name: initHidden

attribute.description: If true, then pane gets resized live while it is dragging. If false, only helper element shows resizing. Default is false.
attribute.name: resizeWhileDragging

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with iframes inside layout panes. If true, this option adds a DIV-mask over-or-inside this pane, so user can drag (resize) the pane over iframe. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskContents

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with objects like applets inside layout panes. If true, this option add IFRAME-mask over-or-inside this pane to cover objects / applets - content-mask will overlay this mask. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskObjects

tag.description: MasterDetail component allows to group contents into levels (sections) and saves page space. Smart and flexible navigation between levels via breadcrumbs or command components gives a neat and stylish interface for users.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Current level in flow. It can be arbitrary initialized and gets updated with each navigation. It allows to show any initial level when a view with MasterDetail component(s) is displayed. Default is 1.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Context value for the current level. It can be arbitrary initialized at beginning and gets updated with each navigation. Default is null.
attribute.name: contextValue

attribute.description: Method with signature int methodName(SelectLevelEvent). Server-side listener invoking when a navigation attempt takes place (via pe:selectDetailLevel). Return value defines the level to go. Default is null.
attribute.name: selectLevelListener

attribute.description: Flag whether a breadcrumb navigation is shown or not. Default is true.
attribute.name: showBreadcrumb

attribute.description: Per default breadcrumb items right from the current level are not shown. This flag allows to show all breadcrumb items right from the current level as disabled. Default is false.
attribute.name: showAllBreadcrumbItems

attribute.description: If true show the breadcrumb at level 1, if false hide it at level 1. Default is true.
attribute.name: showBreadcrumbFirstLevel

attribute.description: Boolean flag to allow rendering of breadcrumb above or below header facet. Default is true.
attribute.name: breadcrumbAboveHeader

attribute.description: Style of the main MasterDetail container element. Default is null.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Style class of the main MasterDetail container element. Default is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Level of this detail. Level is unique inside of masterDetail component. This is a required attribute. Default is none.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Variable to access the value set by pe:selectDetailLevel when the level is changed. If the value was not set by currently invoking pe:selectDetailLevel, the last set value is be used. Default is null.
attribute.name: contextVar

attribute.description: Label for the corresponding breadcrumb item shown on top. Default is none.
attribute.name: levelLabel

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether the breadcrumb item is disabled (not clickable). Default is dalse.
attribute.name: levelDisabled

attribute.description: Context value passing to the level to be navigated. Value defined here is accessible by contextVar in MasterDetailLevel. Default is none.
attribute.name: contextValue

attribute.description: Listener method which is fired before action / actionListener of component, pe:selectDetailLevel is attached to, gets called. Return value of this listener is used as a new / modified contextValue. The listener allows to pass a new / modified contextValue between levels. Default is none.
attribute.name: listener

attribute.description: Level to go to. Default is none.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Specifies how many steps to go. Can be negative. If level and step are not specified, then step = 1 is assumed. Default is none.
attribute.name: step

attribute.description: Specifies comma or blank separated list of clientIds of editable components whose inputs have to be preserved while levels get switched. @all is allowed and means all values within master detail have to be preserved. It makes sense e.g. if corresponding command component has "immediate"=true attribute. If nothing specified, input values gets cleared.
attribute.name: preserveInputs

attribute.description: Specifies comma or blank separated list of clientIds of editable components whose inputs have to be cleared while levels get switched. @all is allowed and means all values within master detail have to be cleared. It takes precedence over clientIds in preserveInputs.
attribute.name: resetInputs

attribute.description: Name(s) of one or several accepted events of f:ajax / p:ajax in case when SelectDetailLevel is attached to any component with ajax behavior. Several events should be defined as space or comma separated list. If no events are specified, all events will be accepted.
attribute.name: event

tag.description: blockUI blocks any piece of page during various Ajax calls.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Styles for the message when blocking. Styles should be defined as JSON object, e.g. {backgroundColor: 'fff', width: 30%}.
attribute.name: css

attribute.description: Styles for the overlay. Styles should be defined as JSON object, e.g. {opacity: 0.4, backgroundColor: 'red'}
attribute.name: cssOverlay

attribute.description: Specifies component(s) which send(s) an ajax request and triggers blocking. If nothing specified, the parent component is used.
attribute.name: source

attribute.description: Specifies component(s) or HTML element(s) to be blocked. If the target is null or not defined, the entire page is blocked.
attribute.name: target

attribute.description: Id of the component in terms of findComponent to be used as content shown during blocking. If nothing specified, the content of blockUI component is used.
attribute.name: content

attribute.description: Name(s) of one or several accepted events. Several events should be defined as space or comma separated list.
attribute.name: event

attribute.description: Flag whether the blocking is shown automatically without the need to use JavaScript widget. Default value is false.
attribute.name: autoShow

attribute.description: Time in millis to wait before auto-unblocking. Don't define it or set to 0 to disable auto-unblock. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: timeout

attribute.description: Set this attribute to true to have the message automatically centered along the X axis. Note: it only effects element blocking (page blocking controlled by CSS via the css attribute). Default value is true.
attribute.name: centerX

attribute.description: Set this attribute to true to have the message automatically centered along the Y axis. Default value is true.
attribute.name: centerY

attribute.description: Fade In time in millis; set to 0 to disable fadeIn on block.
attribute.name: fadeIn

attribute.description: Fade Out time in millis; set to 0 to disable fadeOut on unblock.
attribute.name: fadeOut

attribute.description: Disable if you do not want to show the overlay. Default value is true.
attribute.name: showOverlay

attribute.description: Focus will be placed in the first available input field when page blocking. Default value is true.
attribute.name: focusInput

tag.description: Time picker component for time (hours / minutes) inputs. Client behavior events: timeSelect - fires when an hour / minutes is selected (org.primefaces.extensions.event.TimeSelectEvent), close - fires when the time picker is closed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.CloseEvent), beforeShow - fires before the time picker is rendered and displayed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.BeforeShowEvent).

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Value of the component. Either java.util.Date or java.time.LocalTime
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Marks component as required.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: A method expression referring to a method validationg the input.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: A method binding expression referring to a method for handling a valuchangeevent.

attribute.description: Message to display when required field validation fails.

attribute.description: Message to display when conversion fails.

attribute.description: Access key to transfer focus to the input element.

attribute.description: Alternate textual description of the input element.

attribute.description: Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality.

attribute.description: Disables the time picker when set to true.

attribute.description: A localized user presentable name for this component.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when input element loses focus and its value has been modified since gaining focus.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when input element is clicked.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when input element is double clicked.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when a pointer input element is pressed down over input element.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when a pointer input element is moved onto input element.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when a pointer input element is released over input element.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when the mouse wheel rolls up or down over an element.
attribute.name: onwheel

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when text within input element is selected by user.
attribute.name: onselect

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when the user copies the content of an element.
attribute.name: oncut

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when the user cuts the content of an element.
attribute.name: oncopy

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when the user pastes some content in an element.
attribute.name: onpaste

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when an element gets user input.
attribute.name: oninput

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when a context menu is triggered.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when an element is invalid.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when the Reset button in a form is clicked.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when the user writes something in a search field.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when an element is dragged.

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute at the end of a drag operation.

attribute.description: Style of the time picker input element.

attribute.description: Style class of the time picker input element.

attribute.description: The character to use to separate hours and minutes. Default is :.

attribute.description: Corner of the dialog to position. Default is 'left top'.

attribute.description: Corner of the input to position. Default is 'left bottom'.

attribute.description: Mode specifies appearance of time picker. Possible values are 'popup', 'spinner', 'inline'. Default is 'spinner'.

attribute.description: Specifies first displayed minute. Possible range is 0-55. Default is 0.

attribute.description: Specifies number of rows for the input tables, minimum 2, makes more sense if you use multiple of 2. Default is 4.

attribute.description: Shows an 'ok' button to confirm the edit. Default is false.

attribute.description: Defines a callback to enable / disable certain hours. Example: function onHourShow(hour). Default is null.

tag.description: Waypoint makes it easy to execute a custom logic whenever you scroll to an element. Client behavior events: reached - fired when the user scrolls past the element. (org.primefaces.extensions.event.WaypointEvent)

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: The target component registered as waypoint. If null, the parent component will be taken as target. Default is null.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: The context defines which scrollable element the waypoint belongs to and acts within. It can be a component or plain HTML element like a div. Default is window if nothing specified.
attribute.name: forContext

attribute.description: If false, this waypoint will be created but will be disabled from triggering. You can call widget's method "enable" to turn it back on. Default is true.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.description: Default waypoints live on the vertical axis. Their offset is calculated in relation to the top of the viewport and they listen for vertical scroll changes. If horizontal is set to true, offset is calculated in relation to the left of the viewport and listens for horizontal scroll changes. For instance, the value 50 means "when the left side of this element reaches 50px from the left side of the viewport". Default is false.
attribute.name: horizontal

attribute.description: This option determines how far the top of the element must be from the top of the viewport to trigger a waypoint (callback function). It can be a number, which is taken as a number of pixels (can be also negativ, e.g. -10), a string representing a percentage of the viewport height (e.g. '50%') or a function that will return a number of pixels. Default is 0.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: If true, and multiple waypoints are triggered in one scroll, this waypoint will trigger even if it is not the last waypoint reached. If false, it will only trigger if it is the last waypoint. Default is true.
attribute.name: continuous

attribute.description: If true, the waypoint will be destroyed when triggered. Default is false.
attribute.name: triggerOnce

tag.description: Timer Component

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Style of the main container element. Default value is null.

attribute.name: interval

attribute.name: update

attribute.description: A method expression to invoke by polling.
attribute.name: listener

attribute.description: Boolean value that determines the phaseId, when true actions are processed at apply_request_values, when false at invoke_application phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.name: onstart

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request is completed.
attribute.name: oncomplete

attribute.description: Component id(s) to process partially instead of whole view.
attribute.name: process

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request fails.
attribute.name: onerror

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request succeeds.
attribute.name: onsuccess

attribute.description: Global ajax requests are listened by ajaxStatus component, setting global to false will not trigger ajaxStatus. Default is true.
attribute.name: global

attribute.description: If less than delay milliseconds elapses between calls to request() only the most recent one is sent and all other requests are discarded. The default value of this option is 300. If the value of delay is the literal string 'none' without the quotes, no delay is used.
attribute.name: delay

attribute.description: The format to use when diplaying the value. Accepted values are: 'percentage' to diplay the remaining time as percentage. 'Human' to print a human readable interval. Any other value will be evaluated as a moment.js format
attribute.name: format

attribute.description: client-side function used to format the remaining duration
attribute.name: formatFunction

attribute.description: When set to true, ajax requests are not queued. Default is false.
attribute.name: async

attribute.description: In autoStart mode, the timer will start immediatly. Default is true.
attribute.name: autoStart

attribute.description: Use this attribute to set the timer direction. Default value is false (backward)
attribute.name: forward

attribute.description: String or java.util.Locale representing user locale. Default is a locale specified in view root.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: set to true to false the timer periodic. Default is true
attribute.name: singleRun

attribute.description: When enabled, only values related to partially processed components would be serialized for ajax instead of whole form.
attribute.name: partialSubmit

attribute.description: If true, indicate that this particular Ajax transaction is a value reset transaction. This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.
attribute.name: resetValues

attribute.description: If true, components which autoUpdate="true" will not be updated for this request. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.
attribute.name: ignoreAutoUpdate

attribute.description: Javascript handler executed every second
attribute.name: ontimerstep

attribute.description: Javascript handler executed the timeout stops
attribute.name: ontimercomplete

attribute.description: Selector to use when partial submit is on, default is ":input" to select all descendant inputs of a partially processed components.
attribute.name: partialSubmitFilter

attribute.description: If true, unresolvable components referenced in the update/process attribute are ignored. Default is 'false' and therefore a ComponentNotFoundException will be thrown.
attribute.name: ignoreComponentNotFound

attribute.name: nodeContent

attribute.name: parentNodeSymbol

attribute.name: draggable

attribute.name: chartClass

attribute.description: Users could zoomin/zoomout the orgchart by mouse wheel if they enable this option. Default is false
attribute.name: zoom

attribute.description: Whether or not to allow the dropdown. If disabled, there is no dropdown arrow, and the selected flag is not clickable. Also we display the selected flag on the right instead because it is just a country marker.
attribute.name: allowDropdown

attribute.description: If there is just a dial code in the input: remove it on blur or submit. This is to prevent just a dial code getting submitted with the form. Requires nationalMode to be set to false.
attribute.name: autoHideDialCode

attribute.description: Set the input's placeholder to an example number for the selected country, and update it if the country changes. You can specify the number type using the placeholderNumberType attribute. By default it is set to "polite", which means it will only set the placeholder if the input doesn't already have one. You can also set it to "aggressive", which will replace any existing placeholder, or "off". Loads the utils script.
attribute.name: autoPlaceholder

attribute.description: In the dropdown, display all countries except the ones you specify here. Either a comma separated string or collection of ISO 2 country codes. Default is none.
attribute.name: excludeCountries

attribute.description: Fix the dropdown width to the input width (rather than being as wide as the longest country name). Defaul false.
attribute.name: fixDropdownWidth

attribute.description: Format the input value (according to the nationalMode option) during initialisation, and on setNumber. Loads the utils script. Default true.
attribute.name: formatOnDisplay

attribute.description: Format the number as the user types. This will automatically be disabled if the user types their own formatting characters. Requires the `utilsScript` option. Default true.
attribute.name: formatAsYouType

attribute.description: Set the initial country selection by specifying it's country code. If you leave initialCountry blank, it will default to the first country in the list. Default is "us".
attribute.name: initialCountry

attribute.description: Add a search input to the top of the dropdown, so users can filter the displayed countries. Defaul false.
attribute.name: countrySearch

attribute.description: Allow users to enter national numbers (and not have to think about international dial codes). Formatting, JS validation and placeholders still work. Defaults is true.
attribute.name: nationalMode

attribute.description: In the dropdown, display only the countries you specify here. Either a comma separated string or collection of ISO 2 country codes. Default is null (so all countries).
attribute.name: onlyCountries

attribute.description: Specify one of "fixed_line", "mobile", "toll_free", "shared_cost", "voip", "personal_number", "pager", "uan", "voicemail" or "unknown". Default is "mobile".
attribute.name: placeholderNumberType

attribute.description: Specify the countries to appear at the top of the list. Either a comma separated string or collection of ISO 2 country codes. Default is none.
attribute.name: preferredCountries

attribute.description: Display the country dial code next to the selected flag so it's not part of the typed number. Note that this will disable nationalMode because technically we are dealing with international numbers, but with the dial code separated. Default false.
attribute.name: separateDialCode

attribute.description: When setting initialCountry to "auto", you must use this attribute to specify a custom function that looks up the user's location, and then calls the success callback with the relevant country code. See showcase for an example. Default null.
attribute.name: geoIpLookup

attribute.description: Localized countries map (key ISO 2 code, value name), or JSON string, example "{'de':'Deutschland'}". Default null.
attribute.name: localizedCountries

tag.description: Keynote is an HTML presentation component that enables to create fully-featured and beautiful presentations. Client behavior events: slideChanged - fires each time the slide changes (org.primefaces.event.KeynoteEvent), slideTransitionEnd - fires instantly as soon as the slide changes (org.primefaces.event.KeynoteEvent).

attribute.description: Enables touch navigation on devices with touch input. Default value is true.
